intro: Crudia gracilis, commonly known as the slender thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are spiny and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a compact cluster. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
